messages.message:
Heads up, if you’re seeing a white screen when you load your local dev, you’ll need to rebuild `webapp`. It’s because we merged in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/68665) which changes how JS bundles are being served to the browser.
• If you’re using `ibdev` or `frontend` template, you can either:
    ◦ Wait 12 hours for the cluster to redeploy
    ◦ Or revert that PR locally until the cluster redeploys.
    ◦ Or build and intercept webapp.
• If you’re using `ibdev-backend`, you’ll need to rebuild `webapp` using <some commands I don’t know>, then `cs restart webapp`
This should be a temporary issue. If you’re still getting a white screen, please let me know in this thread.

> • If you’re using `ibdev` or `frontend` template, you can either:
>     ◦ Wait 12 hours for the cluster to redeploy
>     ◦ Or revert that PR locally until the cluster redeploys.
>     ◦ Or build and intercept webapp.
i thought the `frontend` template already runs webapp in the sandbox?

> • If you’re using `ibdev-backend`, you’ll need to rebuild `webapp` using <some commands I don’t know>, then `cs restart webapp`
`cs restart webapp` both rebuilds and restarts webapp, so that's all you need!

>  i thought the `frontend` template already runs webapp in the sandbox?
By default, it uses the prebuilt docker image to run `webapp` locally, so it’ll still be outdated. I don’t know when or where that image gets rebuilt, maybe @sean.donohoe knows.

I suppose what I really mean is to not use the “lite” containers and build/run it yourself like so:
```cs sandbox update -D 'dev/env[WEBAPP_LITE_ENABLED]=0' -D 'dev/env[WEBAPP_ENABLED]=1'
workspace setup
cd ~instabase/webserver/webapp && make build-docker
cs restart webapp```
(again, ^ only for `frontend` and `ibdev` users who encounter the white screen)
